result.execSummary:
The defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete treatment and/or educational programs. Pay costs. Credit: 5 days.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Can be transferred to Green County. Huber granted.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for MacKenzie L. Welacha
Current: 1107 2nd Street, New Glarus, WI 53574 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2017)
Prior: 1515 State Street, Ruth House, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States

Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin prior to the arrival of Atty. Jennifer Harper. Defense informs the Court that the Def will waive the prelim. Court's colloquy with def re prelim waiver. Waiver accepted. Bindover ordered. Information being filed today. To the anticipated information, with same charge as the complaint, Def pleas no contest. Court's colloquy on plea. (DA Harper makes the appearance for the State at this point.) Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 3 years probation. Attend, pay for, successfully complete treatment and/or educational programs. Pay costs. Credit: 5 days.
Atty. Edwards' request to move the plea/sentencing from 5/17 to 5/19; no objection from DA. Clerk sets 5/19 at 10:45.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 29, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. The State is reviewing another matter that involves the def and asks for a setover.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 11, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Suzanne Edwards appears by phone for the defendant. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha in court.  Court notes warrant has been quashed; adjourns this matter to 1/11.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

3:45 p.m.  Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Suzanne Edwards in court for Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha.  Atty. E notes that def contacted DA's office at about 2:00, indicating that she was on her way from LaCrosse; Edwards notes that def had an appearance earlier this afternoon in LaCrosse County and perhaps that is the reason for the delay in her arriving today.  DA asks for warrant, stayed til 11/22 at 1:30.  So ordered.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Def from Richland County Jail
see written minutes (Court ordered defendant readmitted to 1-20-16 signature bond)
RCSD - Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (In Custody Richland County Jail)

1:54 p.m.  Attorney Suzanne Edwards in court for Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha not in court.  Atty. E states she does not know why def is not in court.  Matter was set for 1:30 today.  Court notes that def appeared by phone last time and was ordered to appear in person today.  Warrant authorized.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Suzanne Edwards in court for Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha appeared by phone means.  Atty. E states that the def waives formal reading of the complaint and waives time limits for holding the prelim.  Court questions why def is not in person today.  Atty. E states that def's ride to court fell through; she's presently in treatment in LaCrosse.  Court orders def to appear in person at next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 04-22-2016 11:00 am

Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Suzanne Edwards not in court. Clerk attempts to contact def counsel but cannot reach her; leaves message.  Court adj. this matter to 4/22 at 11. Clerk will send notice to Atty. E; provides notice as well to def.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-04-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Suzanne Edwards appeared by phone means for Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha; states def is not here as she is very ill.  Atty. E asks for adjournment.  Court sets 3/4 at 2 for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Letter from Atty SE, asking for reschedule.
State
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-24-2016 02:30 pm
State
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-24-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant to submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine as requested/demanded by law enforcement.  Defendant to submit to printing/booking at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before leaving the courthouse today, 1/20/16.

Defendant MacKenzie L. Welacha in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  DA requests $2500 signature bond - test on demand of blood, breath or urine.  Def also to submit to booking/printing at the RCSD before leaving the courthouse today.  So ordered.  Court informs def of her rights including right to counsel; instructs def to call SPD re eligibility.  Def to report back to Court re counsel appointment after call to SPD.  Next court date set for 2/24 at 2:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance at 01-20-2016 02:30 pm
Def has requested rescheduling of Jan. 6th court date; no objection from DA's office (request contained in same correspondence as change of address notification)
